as a torrent. How to work around needing the

T.:.

Dear tfowler7,

Many thanks for your share. It's great and now I found solution. 

***
well? what is it?

I copied the files to a blank cd using the standard
CD Writing Wizard in Windows XP under Files - 
write these files to cd option . This worked on 
my system so hopefully it will on others as well,
If not, let me know and I'll find other methods.
Thanks,
T.:.

what version of quickbooks this program is applicable? can it be applied on qb 2011?

tHANKS!

I've already downloaded it and installed on my computer. I've just compressed the files into an iso cd format so I can mount it virtually in my virtual drive using poweriso. this is great! btw, its for qb 2011.

I used these files to create an ISO image and mounted it with magicISO (free program)...runs fine. Creating ISOs not very hard tfowler7 - try out something like WINISO, or UltraISO next time, I think you will like it once learned :-) Thanks again for the files!

Hey, thanks a lot for the upload, it works great! This is exactly what I needed, now I can finally put QuickBooks on my resume and hopefully get a job, haha.

Also, I originally transferred it to a CD and it did not work. I tried all that mounting ISO nonsense and got nothing but trouble.
I just made a small error and wanted to let you guys know so you don'y have to deal with the same issues in the future. 
When uploading the files onto a CD, do not upload the entire folder as a whole. Instead, open the folder and drag all the contents onto the CD. Then just reinsert the CD and it should work fine.
(also make sure you save it as a CD/DVD, not as a flash drive)

Yeah why all this ISO disc mounting nonsense? What a waste of time. Who still uses CDs and DVDs for software in 2011?? I've had a stack of 50 blanks sitting on my desk for years and this is the first time I've ever had to touch one. Thanks, but I think I'll find a training solution that's just a regular, normal,  standard avi file (or folder of them).
Honestly, it's like being forced to ride a horse and buggy to work because your boss refuses to allow cars.
Works just fine.  See comments by AxeEffect.
